xocs:funding-list.xocs:funding-text: Manuscript received December 25, 2020; revised February 25, 2021; accepted March 14, 2021. Date of publication March 24, 2021; date of current version April 2, 2021. This work was supported in part by the National Natural Science Foundation of China (NNSFC) under Grant 61771240 and in part by the Six Talent Peaks Project in Jiangsu Province of China under Grant XYDXX-058. The Associate Editor coordinating the review process was Huang-Chen Lee. (Corresponding authors: Xiaolei Yu; Zhimin Zhao.) Lin Li, Zhenlu Liu, Zhimin Zhao, Ke Zhang, and Shanhao Zhou are with the College of Science, Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, Nanjing 210016, China (e-mail: nuaa_lilin@nuaa.edu.cn; lzl4997@nuaa.edu.cn; zhaozhimin@nuaa.edu.cn; zk20201009@163.com; nuaazhoushanhao@126.com).

head.citation-title: RFID Dynamic Performance Measurement System Embedded in Multiscale Deep Learning
head.abstracts: Â© 1963-2012 IEEE.Multitag sensitivity would be affected by electromagnetic coupling during simultaneous reading. The reading distance of multitag depends on the least sensitivity and operating power of all tags, which is an indicator of reading performance. The main purpose of this article is to optimize the reading performance of multitag by embedding deep learning, while the reading distance of multitag changes with the 3-D geometric structure. Dynamic multitag image deblurring based on multiscale convolutional neural network (MCNN) improves image restoration ability and clarity. Also, tag detection from the estimated image via YOLOv3 improved by feature enhancement (YOLOv3_f) can improve the detection ability of small size targets, and mean average precision (mAP) is increased by 16.4%. Finally, the 3-D coordinates of tags in pixel space are converted into 3-D coordinates of world space by a quaternion. Comparing our system with the positioning method without deblurring, the 3-D coordinate structures are tested in the dynamic measurement system. The experimental results show that the reading performance of the designed RFID system has been greatly improved as the number of tags increases. Our scheme can improve the reading distance of multitag from the physical structure and the anticollision ability of the RFID system.

coredata.dc:description: Multitag sensitivity would be affected by electromagnetic coupling during simultaneous reading. The reading distance of multitag depends on the least sensitivity and operating power of all tags, which is an indicator of reading performance. The main purpose of this article is to optimize the reading performance of multitag by embedding deep learning, while the reading distance of multitag changes with the 3-D geometric structure. Dynamic multitag image deblurring based on multiscale convolutional neural network (MCNN) improves image restoration ability and clarity. Also, tag detection from the estimated image via YOLOv3 improved by feature enhancement (YOLOv3_f) can improve the detection ability of small size targets, and mean average precision (mAP) is increased by 16.4%. Finally, the 3-D coordinates of tags in pixel space are converted into 3-D coordinates of world space by a quaternion. Comparing our system with the positioning method without deblurring, the 3-D coordinate structures are tested in the dynamic measurement system. The experimental results show that the reading performance of the designed RFID system has been greatly improved as the number of tags increases. Our scheme can improve the reading distance of multitag from the physical structure and the anticollision ability of the RFID system.
coredata.prism:publicationName: IEEE Transactions on Instrumentation and Measurement
coredata.dc:title: RFID Dynamic Performance Measurement System Embedded in Multiscale Deep Learning
coredata.dc:publisher: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers Inc.
